name: Chip's Challenge 1
description: Before Chip can join the Bit Busters computer club and hang out with the girl of his dreams, Melinda the Mental Marvel, he must solve all 144 challenging puzzles. Your bird's-eye view can help Chip rush through the puzzles and mazes before he's deleted by monsters, traps and the passage of time.
minimum_requirements: OS: Vista Processor: 1 Ghz or faster processor Memory: 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 6.0 Storage: 100 MB available space Sound Card: 16-bit sound card
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or 8 Processor: 1 Ghz or faster processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Network: Broadband Internet connection

reviews.review_text: This is a faithful remake using the CC2 engine of the orginal game. It's more closer to the orginal Lynx version with it's animated tiles, than the Microsoft made one that was in Microsoft's Entertainment Pack Four (and the microsoft version have a few bugs and mistakes). As this is a game I played since I even obtained my first Compaq 486 computer, I think this is one of the ulterior classic puzzle games and worth picking up if you never played it before.  The only complaint is that it runs at a fixed resolution, should been a option to zoom in 2x-3x.

Have you ever played a Pokémon game and thought, 'This is an alright game, but it would be better if it was nothing but gym puzzle maps with ragtime music in the background'? If so, this game is for you.
This game is one of the first games I have played (at least what I remember). Other are SkiFree and Supaplex. It can be quite a challenge...
If you can get past the Slip and Slide controls and the DOS graphics, Chip's Challenge 1 Is an extremely good puzzle game.

Played this on the Atari Lynx handheld way back, lol, and gaming does not come much simpler and better than this. Admittedly, the music from the Lynx version was miles better than this, but that is easily rectified, due to some clever folks on here modding it in. A great time waster of a game, and one of my all time favorites at sucking you in, for that one more try at the level you cant beat. We never had saves back then, so you had to beat it to get code for next level. Ah, them were the days!  Great stuff!

The nostalgia trip is real. It's great to finally see this gem from the late 80's being re-released on Steam. Prepare for that frustration you once felt, hopefully you can resist to smash your keyboard as you retry the same level over and over again. Great puzzle game, would recommend any day.

The puzzles are incredibly hard (CURSE YOU NUTS AND BOLTS AND YOUR PATH!!!!), but there's alot of satisfaction when you complete a level because you solved it.  And by the way, Chips Challenge 2. It was previously unreleased (IDK why) but ported over, go give that a try (and the level editor!).

Simple but great puzzle game.  Me am my younger brother played this as kids ages ago... until the old pentium PC gave up the ghost  The bottom line:   Collect all chips and head for the exit on each level. Colourful and intuitive. Despite a limited set of sprites and game mechanics there is enough variety to design a ton of levels. Excellent time sink or for a quick break. Music is repetitive but you can mute it. Price tag seems high for simple abandonware but I don't mind.  Definitely recommend for anyone who played it before and enjoyed it.  PS - who else thinks blobnet level 23 qualifies for cruel and unusual punishment?
